lexUnit.name: compulsive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: resulting from or acting on an irresistible urge or compulsion

sentence.text: In retrospect it suggests , like many gambles , a kind of compulsive behaviour .
Similarly , many other forms of compulsive behaviour are easily recognised even though there may be considerable debate if one has the temerity to apply the term " addiction " .
What 's the difference between bulimia and compulsive eating ?
When I understood the reason for my compulsive shopping , it became possible -- though not easy -- to stop .
They are unaware of his compulsive gambling , psychopathic persona and unorthodox sexual proclivities .
The distress caused by compulsive gambling is very considerable .
The consequences of compulsive gambling are comparable to those of any other addictive disease and are not simply those of financial loss .
As such , she is a compulsive user of the telephone , and rings everyone , especially friends and family .
But amusingly , he soon discovers that Brenda is in fact frigid and that her accounts of London lovers are the fantasies of a compulsive liar .
Strange as it may sound , compulsive shoppers very often do n't even wear their look -- in contrast , of course , to the average shopper who flaunts a new frock or jumper to death .
Most compulsive gamblers are not hugely successful .
It may appear paradoxical but the compulsive gambler may get the biggest adrenalin surge from the biggest loss and , like the proverbial fisherman , may boast of the " one that got away " .
I tried joining another group , this time for compulsive eaters .
` Compulsive spenders will binge in the same way as alcoholics "
Perhaps the most obvious example is Jaggers almost compulsive washing of hands which hints towards him feeling guilty perhaps about the way he runs his business and treats his clients .
She developed a compulsive need to accumulate vast stocks of whatever attractive goods were available ` under the counter " .

The caffeine addict or compulsive cigarette smoker may initially find it difficult to identify with someone addicted to Valium or Heroin but the stigma of addictive disease is inappropriate and the commonality of all addictions is considerable .
He is quick to defend the actions of the few compulsive thieves who , he says , are mentally ill .
